resources.string: Hold your device always in front of your body
SmartNavi was not able to get an initial position.\nPlease enable internet or GPS and restart SmartNavi,\nor contact our support: info@smartnavi.app
SmartNavi is OpenSource and offers\nstep-based and GPS independent navigation.
Please enter your body height, so that your step length can be determined.
Touch and hold the map to get extra options. So you can set your exact start position.
Nearly there!\n\nPlease select SmartNavi as mock location app in the Developer options.
No Result. Check internet connection and try again.
Could not get route information. Please try again later.
It seems that you like SmartNavi. :) \nYour rating would be great support for us!

SmartNavi recognizes steps by using accelerometer and magnetic-field-sensor data. Every step changes the position in the corresponding direction. Internal error correction guarantees a durable accuracy. The startposition will be located by using either GPS or UMTS/Wifi/GSM locationing. By using internal sensors instead of GPS, SmartNavi can save up to 80% energy and therefore battery life.

Unfortunately your device does not seem to have a magnetic field sensor (compass). SmartNavi can not work without that.
More information on our website:
www.smartnavi.mobi
Your step length is calculated by using your height
Exports the route you walk in a GPX-file on your SD-Card
SmartNavi can provide location data for other apps.
Use this feature to navigate with other apps stepbased and energy-saving.
No results were found for your request.
Enable GPS to get a better initial position.\nAfter getting your initial position SmartNavi works independent from GPS! :)
Corrects your position regularly with GPS
GPX-File will be created in Folder \"smartnavi\"
SmartNavi recognizes your steps by using internal sensors
Be independent from GPS and save up to 80% battery
SmartNavi is open source and respects your privacy
SmartNavi needs permission for location services.
SmartNavi needs permission to save map data to storage.
An error occurred. Please try again later.

In order to proceed you have to enable Developer Options on your device.

To do this tap 7 times on the Build Number in your settings.

On some devices the Build Number can be found under Software Information.

Then come back and try again.
